body:
Comment 1: 
Windows do not understand GNU Makefiles by default AFAIK, so there's no reason to expect
a GNU Makefile to work at all on Windows - you're using an unsupported tool.

Use go tool yacc and go build (will also handle the "executable" extension).

And no, I don't think it "need support '\r' character" - it's only a demo, not a real
tool.
